DOCNAME: STATE HOLDING COMPANY LUGANSKVUGILLYA v. UKRAINE
JUDGES: Isabelle Berro-Lefèvre;Karel Jungwiert;Mark Villiger;Peer Lorenzen;Rait Maruste;Renate Jaeger;Stanislav Shevchuk
TEXT: The applicant is a legal entity , a state holding company , ORG холдингова компанія « PERSON ) , registered in GPE , GPE . It is represented before the ORG by Mr PERSON , a practicing lawyer .
On DATE the local department of ORG imposed a fine on the applicant company for failure to comply with the legislation on market circulation of shares .
In DATE the applicant company lodged a complaint with ORG against the aforementioned resolution of the Commission to impose a fine on it .
On DATE the court rejected this complaint as it was unsubstantiated . On DATE ORG upheld that judgment .

The applicant lodged an appeal in cassation with ORG , which on DATE refused to examine it for the applicant ’s failure to comply with the formal requirements envisaged in LAW for lodging such appeals .
On DATE ORG refused to institute cassation proceedings upon the applicant ’s appeal in cassation lodged against the resolution of DATE .

From extensive domestic law , including the acts of ORG , normative acts of ORG and various ministerial decisions and orders it ensues that the applicant company is managed and fully controlled by ORG of GPE , through its various institutional structures , including formerly through ORG and currently ORG of GPE . The company exercised certain public functions in administration of funds allocated by the ORG for restructuring of the coal industry .

On DATE ORG of GPE by an order no . CARDINAL , acting in accordance with ORG of GPE , ORG and ORG , ordered the liquidation of the state holding company ORG . The liquidation proceedings are still pending .
